---
title: "config.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file is used to customize the GitHub Issues experience for the repository. It disables blank issues and provides a link to the Loophole Labs community support channel on Discord for asking and answering questions.

## Symbols

### `blank_issues_enabled`
#### Description
This setting controls whether users can create blank issues in the repository.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| blank_issues_enabled | boolean | Determines if blank issues are allowed |

#### Outputs
None

### `contact_links`
#### Description
This section defines external links for users to get support or ask questions outside of the GitHub Issues system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| name | string | The display name for the contact link |
| url | string | The URL of the external resource |
| about | string | A brief description of the purpose of the link |

#### Outputs
None

## Dependencies
This configuration file relies on GitHub's issue template system and YAML parsing.

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| blank_issues_enabled | boolean | false | Disables the creation of blank issues |

## API/Interface Reference
While not an API in the traditional sense, this configuration file interfaces with GitHub's issue management system:

| Setting | Value | Description |
|:--------|:------|:------------|
| blank_issues_enabled | false | Prevents users from creating blank issues |
| contact_links | Array of link objects | Provides a link to the Loophole Labs Discord for community support |

This configuration ensures that users are directed to the appropriate channels for support and prevents the creation of unstructured issues, which can help maintain a more organized issue tracker for the project.
